snippet: The C.I.A. said that it did not suspect Edward J. Snowden of gaining access to computer files without authorization when he was working as a technician for the agency in 2009.
abstract: Central Intelligence Agency says it did not suspect Edward J Snowden of gaining access to computer files without authorization when he was working as technician for agency in Geneva in 2009, and did not send him home as a result; assertion follows New York Times reports that Snowden's supervisor had noticed change in his behavior.
lead_paragraph: The C.I.A. said that it did not suspect Edward J. Snowden of gaining access to computer files without authorization when he was working as a technician for the agency in 2009.

headline.main: C.I.A. Disputes Early Suspicions on Snowden
headline.print_headline: C.I.A. Says It Did Not Have Early Suspicions About Snowden
